definition: lit. the red apricot tree leans over the garden wall (idiom)/fig. a wife having an illicit lover
surname Hong
red/popular/revolutionary/bonus
apricot/almond

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall

sentences.english: It is rumored that his wife goes off the rails.
sentences.chinese: 据说他的妻子红杏出墙。

sentences.english: Read on to learn how to know if your girlfriend is cheating on you.
sentences.chinese: 继续读，来学习怎样探测你的女友是否红杏出墙。

sentences.english: You consider a red almond wall?
She departs with a shepherd the night after Aimable produces his first breads.
sentences.chinese: 不料他妻子红杏出墙，跟一个帅气的牧羊人跑了。

sentences.english: Can't be a so fierce and ruddy good Tong surname almond wall to call four the elder brother took a cuckold husband?
sentences.chinese: 不会是佟佳氏这么猛红杏出墙叫四阿哥带绿帽子了吧？

sentences.english: Some talented penguin teasers can get a gift even without putting out.
sentences.chinese: 有些聪明的企鹅不需要红杏出墙就能得到礼物。
